etymologies: mid 19th century: from French (le jeu de) la crosse ‘(the game of) the hooked stick’. Compare with crosse

definitions: a team game, originally played by North American Indians, in which the ball is thrown, caught, and carried with a long-handled stick having a curved L-shaped or triangular frame at one end with a piece of shallow netting in the angle.
shortDefinitions: team game, originally played by North American Indians, in which ball is thrown, carried, and caught with long-handled stick
